availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Tomlinson (Mercer County, KY, physician/farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, physician and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Tomlinson. Father of Bettie A. Tomlinson, Mary B. Tomlinson, William H. Tomlinson, and Albert J. Tomlinson. Owned six enslaved people in Mercer County in 1850. Physician in Mercer County in 1850. Owned thirteen enslaved people in Mercer County in 1860. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Physician in Mercer County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 368B

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 910
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 50B
Find A Grave, "William M. Tomlinson (Birth-Death)," Memorial #98315026, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98315026 (accessed October 8, 2019).
